meanings.definition: Feeling or showing bitterness or indignation at having been treated unfairly.
meanings.sent1: She gave a resentfully glare to her friend who had betrayed her.
meanings.sent2: The boy looked resentfully at the broken toy, feeling upset.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked resentfully at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds hung in the sky resentfully, as if angry at the sun.
meanings.sent5: The old tree stood resentfully in the corner of the garden, neglected and sad.

meanings.definition: In a manner characterized by bitterness or indignation at having been treated unfairly.
meanings.sent1: She spoke resentfully about the unfair treatment she had received.
meanings.sent2: He walked resentfully away from the argument, feeling hurt.
meanings.sent3: The child pouted resentfully when told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled resentfully through the empty streets at night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher looked resentfully at the messy classroom, wishing for order.
